data.title: Nice Mall
data.text: Nice selection of stores and easier to traverse than Lancaster Mall in my opinion, plenty of parking opitons.

data.title: All brands at one place
data.text:
For a city like Salem, this is a good one stop shop for all major brands.
It doesn't have all the varieties that you might be looking for, but its in a good part of town, close to riverfront & capitol.

data.title: A Fall From Grace
data.text: At one time a thriving, top tier retailer in Salem.  But the glory days of mall shopping are past and I am afraid this is showing the signs of being left behind with all (with a few exceptions) the retailers being second tier at best.  Sad to see.

data.title: Lots of Stores Here
data.text: As malls go, the Salem Center is clean and has many stores from which to stop and shop. Be prepared for a long walk if you plan to cover this rather spread out mall. There are clothing stores, shoe stores, candy stores, JC Penny, Macy's, Kohl's, Nordstroms, etc., among the many. For the most part, the employees in the various stores are nice to deal with, although, during the holidays, they can range from arrogant to just a pain in the butt.

data.title: Good mall, especially for walking
data.text: Great mall for a downtown area, Plenty of stores, few vacancies, lots of different stores and the mall standards, Took me a while to find the food court, but pleasant assortment of food.

data.title: Shopping!
data.text: This shopping center is downtown Salem, Or.  Undercover parking garage. Covered sky bridges which lead to 4 blocks of shopping.  There is a great food court. This is definitely shopping at its best.

data.title: Love to shop
data.text: Great mall. Plenty of small boutiques and chain retailers. I do wish there were better options in the food court.

data.title: Great shops
data.text: If you want a great cup of coffee it's here. If you have a sweet tooth,well there a nice candy shop for that as well. If you need clothes for everyone in your family,then your at the right place. Hungry? Lots of choices in their food court. Feeling romantic? There is a shop for you!! Expecting? Yes you will find a store for mothers to be. Made in Oregon shop for that unique gift. Need shoes? There is a big store full of many choices at affordable prices. Many shops and store to spend a big part of your day, A great place!!!

data.title: Downtown Salem Mall
data.text: Good place to find what you need in one stop.  I visit there often.  Has a good food court for midday lunch.  Also all three major phone carriers have stores to take care of your phone problems.

data.title: During the last week when we have had snow and icy conditions in this area, we use the Salem Center to do our walking.
data.text: The stores located in Salem Center are the best there is in one place.  Salem Center is centrally located and parking is very convenient and free.

data.title: Holiday Shopping
data.text: I made it out Christmas Shopping this week and visited the Salem Center.  The nice thing about the time (1800) a small amount of people were out and about.  Mainly shopped at Kohls and JC Penny but strolled through the mall checking out the sales and store fronts.  Had a pleasant evening.

data.title: Great comprehensive shopping in the beautiful downtown!
data.text: Besides having all this indoor shopping right downtown amidst the restaurants, pubs, Elsinore theater, etc, the parking is free and even in the rain you can walk from store to store without getting wet. There is a Kohl's, Macy's, Penny's and many small boutique shops and a food court on a few different levels. An indoor mall with no traffic, easy free parking, with restaurants, movie theaters, and virtually anything else you might need is a real winner!

data.title: All my favorites in one place
data.text: All of the stores are exceptionally clean, important to me, the clerks are always helpful.  The Food court is a great place to stop and restore yourself after enjoying shopping.

data.title: Why I shop at Salem Center
data.text: Love to shop at Salem Center.  We only have two big malls here in Salem, and this one is right downtown.  There is a nice food court upstairs that helps one relax after a few hours of shopping.  School clothes will all be on sale this week, so we will be headed down there to help with grand kids badk to school shopping.  Kohls, Macys, Pennys, are the big chain stores there, as well as several shoe stores, several kiosks that change with the seasons.  A nice walkway from the parking lot and to other shops keeps one nice and dry in our rainy season.

data.title: Shopping with Grandson's
data.text: Nice and spacious Mall. Very bright and clean. Several major retailers and a lot of smaller shops makes your shopping experience easy. Stores are clean, bright and very well maintained. Selection of merchandise is great with excellent pricing. Food Court fills empty void from all the shopping. Lots of free parking. Great place to hang out.

data.title: Nice shopping area
data.text: Great downtown shopping "mall."  Connected by glass bridges across city streets.  Great stores and good, free parking.

data.title: Nice indoor mall
data.text: Love this place in the winter and especially at Christmas. No walking in the rain and you can get to so many stores all connected. Parking is easy in the structure across the street.

data.title: A good place to shop for a variety of goods when visiting downtown Salem, Oregon.
data.text: A good place to shop in downtown Salem, Oregon.  Not necessarily the greatest of all malls, but for a mid-sized American city such as Salem is, it's an "O.K." place to shop.  It has a vibrant food court with some good places to eat, but definitely needs to expand to offer more.  All in all it's a pleasant way to shop for a variety of goods when visiting downtown Salem, Oregon.

data.title: Excelentes lojas no centro histórico e com taxa zero !
data.text: No centro histórico de Salem vc encontra o Salem Center. Na realidade não é um shopping fechado ou um outlet tipo os Premium. São várias lojas de marca como VS, BBW, American Eagle, Aeropostale, etc e âncoras como Macy's, Nordstrom com quiosque da MAC, JC Penny, etc, que ocupam alguns quarteirões no centro da cidade e são conectadas por passarelas fechadas de vidro. Tem estacionamento gratuito, siga as placas indicativas quando estiver rodando de carro pelas ruas do Center. O estacionamento é coberto e também tem ligação com passarela fechada de vidro. O melhor de tudo é que em Salem, como em todo o Oregon, a taxa de venda é ZERO ! Show !!!
